title: Self-determination
summary: Young people need and want to have more of a role in decision making, including how funds are directed and what programs operate in Mount Druitt.

title: Stand against racism
summary: Change the way people look at young people in Mount Druitt by ending racial profiling, harmful stereotypes, and over-policing of Aboriginal kids.

title: Invest in young people
summary: Redirect resources into flexible, community-led support instead of incarcerationâ€”it costs $1,956 per day to keep a young person locked up.

title: Aboriginal controlled youth service
summary: Create a Mount Druitt hub run by mob that offers after-hours drop-in support, cultural programs, bail-safe space, and mentors who know the system.

title: Justice: policing reforms
summary: Stop racially targeted policing practices, end punitive fines, and bring Youth Justice reporting options back to Mount Druitt so support is accessible.

title: Education and learning
summary: Schools must centre Aboriginal histories, remove cost barriers to the activities that keep kids engaged, and resource more teacher aides and after-hours support.
